name: paper production, woodcontaining, lightweight coated | paper, woodcontaining, lightweight coated | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/7895/documentation

Lightweight coated (LWC) paper is the coated type of mechanical paper which means that less than 90% of the fibres are in form of chemical pulp. It is predominantly used for print materials such as magazines and journals that require a higher paper quality than newsprint paper. Usually, this kind of paper mills contain an integrated mechanical pulp production and sometimes also an integrated deinking equipment for recovered paper. The used sulfate pulp is usually produced outside of the paper mill.;;The main sources for this LWC paper dataset is a questionnaire from a European LWC paper producer and several environmental reports from further European paper mills (Albbruck (2001); Dachau (2001); Jämsä River Mill (2000); Plattling (2001); Rauma Mill (2001)). Further sources are the Finnish EcoData database from KCL (KCL (2002)), the German inventory study about graphical paper (Tiedemann et al. (2000)) and the European IPPC documentation for the paper and pulp industry (European Commission (2000)).;;References:;Albbruck (2001) Umwelterklärung 2000. MD Papier GmbH und Co.KG, Albbruck (Germany);;Dachau (2001) Umwelterklärung 2000. MD Papier GmbH und Co.KG, Dachau (Germany);;Jämsä River Mill (2000) Environmental statement 1999. UPM-Kymmene, Jämsänkoski (Finland) as pdf-File under: http://www.paper.upm-kymmene.com;;Plattling (2001) Umwelterklärung 2000. MD Papier GmbH und Co.KG, Platt-ling (Germany);;Rauma Mill (2001) Environmental report 2000. UPM-Kymmene, Rauma (Fin-land) as pdf-File under: http://www.paper.upm-kymmene.com;;Further References;;European Commission (2000) Integrated Pollution Prevention and Control (IPPC) - Reference Document on Best Available Techniques in the Pulp and Paper Industry. Institute for Prospective Technological Studies, Sevilla;;KCL (2002) KCL EcoData - life cycle inventory database. The Finnish Pulp and Paper Research Institute (KCL), Espoo (Finnland);;Tiedemann A., Böttcher Tiedemann C., Buschardt A., Georgi B., Giersberg G., Goosmann G., Gregor H.-D., Mehlhorn B., Modi A., Neitzel H., Oels H.-J., Schmitz S. and Suhr M. (2000) Ökobilanzen für graphische Papiere. Texte 22/00. Umweltbundesamt, Berlin

This activity starts with the reception of the raw materials, such as pulpwood and sulfate market pulp.

This dataset represents the European production of LWC paper - including wood handling, mechanical pulping and bleaching, deinking of waste paper, paper production, energy production on-site and internal waste water treatment. A small amount of waste paper input (4.3% of output paper weight) has been included in the amount of pulp. The sorting of this paper and the related by-products have been excluded, since the sorting of unsorted paper takes place in a separate activity.
category: C:Manufacturing/17:Manufacture of paper and paper products/170:Manufacture of paper and paper products/1701:Manufacture of pulp, paper and paperboard

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data represent the average technology in the late 1990ies and early 2000s. The production volume is valid for 2018.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data from several European LWC paper producers used as European average data.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Based on literature and statistics (see dataset field “Published Source”)
